sentences: Ta vaataks sind paremini, kui sa naerataksid.
Kas sa vaataksin seda asja ka?
context: The verb 'vaataks' is a conditional form of the Estonian verb 'vaadata', meaning 'to look,' 'to watch,' or 'to see.' It expresses what someone would do under certain circumstances. In English, it’s similar to saying ‘would look,’ ‘would watch,’ or ‘would see.’
